examples: We have no contemporary account of the battle (= written near the time that it happened).
contemporary with somebody/something He was contemporary with the dramatist Congreve.
The amphitheatre is roughly contemporary with the Colosseum in Rome.
She used only strictly contemporary documents to research the book.
a period broadly contemporary with the Shang dynasty
He is among the best-known contemporary artists.
The film paints a depressing picture of life in contemporary Britain.
She is one of the great innovators of contemporary dance.
The prize is awarded for the best piece of contemporary fiction published in that year.
This approach has contributed to growing inequality almost everywhere in the contemproary world.

meanings.def: following modern ideas in style or design
examples: Try some contemporary colours on your kitchen walls.

meanings.def: a person who lives or lived at the same time as somebody else, especially somebody who is about the same age
examples: She and I were contemporaries at college.
He was a contemporary of Freud and may have known him.
Give or take a few years, they are contemporaries.
